description: Borrowed from Latin recūsans, recūsāntis, from recūsō (“I refuse, decline; I object to; I protest”). See recuse.

entries.meaning: pertaining to a recusant or to recusancy
examples: Still, to disobey a direct order in the field is no small matter in any circumstances, and especially in Sparta.  The recusant captains must have known how dangerous their defiance was to them, yet they risked it.

entries.meaning: (historical) Someone refusing to attend Church of England services, between the 16th and early 19th centuries.
Anyone refusing to submit to authority or regulation.
